question: Does SRRM4 regulate neuronal-specific microexon splicing of TAF1 mRNA?
ideal_answer: Neuronal-specific microexon splicing of TAF1 mRNA is directly regulated by SRRM4/nSR100.

snippets.text: Neuronal-specific microexon splicing of TAF1 mRNA is directly regulated by SRRM4/nSR100.

Knockdown and ectopic expression experiments demonstrate that the neuronal-specific splicing factor SRRM4/nSR100 promotes the inclusion of microexon 34' into TAF1 mRNA, through the recognition of UGC sequences in the poly-pyrimidine tract upstream of the regulated microexon.
